column17: Which metadata representation in MetaSEMAP did you find easiest to read and understand when annotating mapping files?
column18: Do you have any additional comments or suggestions on how we can improve the design of MetaSEMAP for annotating mapping files? Please share your thoughts below.
Everyone can use this tool as it is very easy to use and user does not require any technical knowledge to use it.
You could add explanatory descriptions for each input field to sometimes better understand what's meant. Like with the question mark for sections but for each field.
Adding features for team collaboration and showing how the metadata impacts the mapping would make the tool even better.
N/A

Options for results of testing has free text input as opposed to a dropdown of options, so I was unclear of what should be written. I decided on "Success" to denote a positive result, but the question seems open ended.
No

For the annotation functionality itself, I think it works well.  
However, when attempting to submit the annotations I had made, I ran into lots of error messages of the kind "TypeError: str should not be of value None" (or something along these lines) with a stack trace of all the internal function calls being made. This happned even though I checked many times that all fields were filled out. I had to use a seperate browser to avoid this in the end. I think cleaner error handling for this kind of error would be useful for user experience.
It was a great and easy to use tool for annotating mapping files

To me everything seemed quite reasonable. I don't feel I meticulously understand the software so I can't give many strong reviews about things (it would maybe be more difficult for me if I was trying to generate metadata for a mapping I'd conducted) but all things considered, it seemed to be working perfectly fine.

It would be even more easier to learn how to use the tool if it gave us a example of a mapping and its metadata, this could be done just by displaying a filled out form for a given mapping or using a video where someone is filling the metadata form and explaining why they are filling certain values for the given fields.

1. Try to add a VALIDATOR for validating annotations that are required to fill in URIs (Allowing input of arbitrary text strings cannot ensure the actual validity of the final annotations).
2. Consider developing the tool with a graphical user interface (GUI) to reduce the learning cost and allow non-professionals to complete annotations easily. (if necessary)
3. Try to add an auto-wrapping mechanism or tags that can make annotations easier and more convenient to read. (When long strings are used as annotations, they are not automatically wrapped)
4. Implement a mechanism to check for invalid characters such as spaces in required fields to prevent incorrect input.
The tool could benefit from more detailed tooltips or guidance for specific metadata fields, especially for new users

The RDF-star representation is easier to read and understand when annotating mapping files in MetaSEMAP due to its inline annotation capability, simplified structure, and compact syntax. By embedding metadata directly within triples, RDF-star provides immediate context and reduces the need for external references or complex graph structures. This approach ensures annotations remain concise, intuitive, and easy to follow, making it more user-friendly compared to the more hierarchical and indirect Named Graph representation.
